title: Here I'll fix tank junglers in a single patch
body:
Rammus: W damage return increased to 25% vs minions and monsters

Hecarim: Rampage damage not reduced vs monsters

Nautilus: W persists after shield is broken 

Skarner: passive stun duration vs monsters increased to 1 second

Zac: killing a large monster with an ability generates three bloblets

Do for these junglers what you did for your Favorite Child Nidalee and the jungle will be balanced again.

I remember an AMA with Yasuo. Riot said that originally his wall broke if player hit it with enough crap, but they scrapped that idea because the "correct" play was the wrong one over and over.  Why is attacking him while he has his shield up rewarded? Shouldn't you wait for it so break like other shield in the game? (I.E. You don't just keep throwing spells at Morgana's black shield, you hit it with AD or wait for it to end.)

Why is Nautilus self buff the only one in the game that is determined by *other* players?

Because the purpose of a shield on a non-tank is to discourage attacking them.  For Yasuo, there is no point in poking him unless you can follow up and hit his health bar after you clear his shield, which is why you basic attack the shield if you can and then hit him after it falls off.  Morgana's shield actively prevents you from CCing the person, so not only does it discourage damage, but CC as well.

Nautilus, on the other hand, is a tank.  A tank WANTS people to attack him, especially while his shield is up.  So, while it is up, he is something of an actual damage threat, spreading around a nasty little DoT.  It is a soft taunt; it doesn't force people to attack him, but strongly encourages it.
Just to be sure, so you agree with the previous post?

Um, no.  The person I replied to was talking about how his damage shouldn't be tied to the shield, because that makes attacking him during the shield the correct play, and shields should be able to be ignored.  I explain how this is only true of DPS.  You wait out Yasuo's shield after proccing it with an autoattack so you can harass  him between shields.  You don't blow CC on Black Shield because it would be a waste.

Nautilus is different because he is a tank.  A tank WANTS people to attack, so he has to give them a reason to do so.  Making Naut's damage buff dependent on the shield acts a soft taunt, and the person I replied to doesn't want this.  I think it is exactly the kind of tank mechanic we need.  The hard CC of a real taunt doesn't much fit the game, honestly, and should be used very sparingly.  Allowing tanks to force people to attack them to reduce their damage is much better.

I would be quite happy if you could prevent or delay Yasuo's innate shield (not the Wind Wall) by attacking him.  This way, a DOT type mage (Teemo) could be a good hard counter because of the constant barrage of DOT.

The proposed Zac change really does nothing for him. His clear time and sustain is excellent if you manage your cooldowns well around picking up bloblets only when W is on CD. 

The problem with Zac is there's really no reason to take him over somebody like Lee Sin or Vi. They bring roughly the same amount of CC but with better damage and better passives. 

If you have a Yasuo though, take Zac as your jungler, you can easily get him fed since Yasuo's ult works off both his E and R. Synergy is strong. 

I mean, don't get me wrong, Zac's still great, I love playing as him. He's a champion I would rank near the top in terms of fun. I just think he needs some sort of tank steroids to really be considered a tank. All he really does is scale his W off his HP for more damage. His passive is also incredibly lackluster and situational.

I would be happy to call myself a zac main as I have a considerable number of games under my belt with him . At the current time I find taking zac very successful as a pure ap burst Mage as his ratios allow for some considerable  damage. 

I feel his abilities just need a little incentive for him to be a tank such as one of his abilities doing damage based on how much health he has and perhaps his e can have a slightly shorter cooldown earlier on just because 24 secs is a awful long time. 

I know it was removed as well but it would be nice if his r ability received the same treatment as Sions does in regard to cc. 

Zac with proper management of his passive should never have to recall except to buy simple fact.

I've played rammus lately jungling (non-ranked). He's a good jungler again, but his lackluster clear is troublesome for leveling compared to some assassins or fighters.

His Powerball could go faster again...  about what it was in I think s2. To many mobility moves now with other champs.
The problems that need to be addressed with tank junglers is surviving the jungle, not obnoxious ganking. Changes should be jungle-related only.

Fellow rammus jung here. My only complaint is when jarvan is on the other team. He's just as tanky, does more damage, has more clear, has better ganks, has better dueling. It's so painful to chase him, fight him.
I've played cho jungle this season and last; he's very underrated. His sustain lets him clear without worry after his first back.

Most of those changes are kinda aweful.

Hec doesn't have problems with clear speed, mana is the main problem he has.
Skarner doesn't worry about taking damage, its the blue bar that concerns him.
Zac already sustains well, its the clear speed that holds him back.

The Naut changes would just be removing the intended counterplay. His shield needs a bit more base value at low levels.

Zac clears fast. He's a bit like Aatrox or Olaf where he's always 30-50% health in the jungle. A big thing about Zac is that his early game sucks. His E is too short range early and his W which is his main DPS is hard to use in ganks because the blob mechanic doesn't work well when you're chasing. His jungle clearing is not a problem at all, he's better than Jarvan or Lee Sin or Nidalee at clearing the jungle in fact. It's that he can't have much impact on lanes until he's lvl 9+. Also, his ultimate is a little awkward for ganking since it's easy to flash away and not take the full damage and the knockback can even ruin his own ultimate. He's a teamfighter, not a ganker. He can really only gank once he's about lvl 9 and once duel once he has two or more items so he can live long enough for his W DPS to come into play.
